item.title: Report X-2023110101
item.description:
Report X-2023110101

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: ROSEVILLE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package was discovered by package handlers while unloading and QA was notified. QA collected the package and placed it in a plastic-lined hazmat tote. DescribePack: The bucket has a 4-inch crack in its base. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA was notified of the leaking hazmat the package was collected and placed in a plastic-lined hazmat tote. Any spillage was then cleaned up and the tote was brought back to the QA square for processing.

Was placed in a hazmat and tote DescribePack: the failure was due to mishandling of the package was caused it to crack DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: to mitigate the release item was placed in a hazmat bag and drum

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET AND LEAKING ON BOTTOM. DescribePack: PLASTIC PAIL DROPPED ONTO STRUCTURAL ANCHOR BOLT CAUSING A PUNCTURE. QUARTER INCH HOLE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED WITH PHNINE AND SMALL BROOM AND DUSTER. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023110076
item.description:
Report X-2023110076

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found in the unload; upon inspection the bottom and side flaps were discovered wet. Package was then placed in a red hazardous bin layered with absorbent sheets and into a clear hazardous materials bag. DescribePack: The package had no visible wet marks, but it did feel damp when further inspecting the box. Upon inner inspection the inner packing was found wet where the lid of the pail is located. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent sheets were used to clean and pick up the package. No release of liquid occurred besides the small amount coming out from the lid.

item.title: Report X-2023110072
item.description:
Report X-2023110072

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was called out leaking in the unload and upon arrival it was discovered as a hazmat. A red hazardous bin layered with absorbent, a clear hazardous materials bag, and another layer of absorbent was used to pick up the package. DescribePack: The outer top flaps of the box were found wet. Upon inner inspection, 3 out of the 4 bottles were found bent from the body and the caps were also loose. The labels on the bottles were also soiled and damaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent sheets were used to cover up the top flaps of the box and placed in the red hazardous bin since the leakage didn't spread beyond the box itself. Sheets used were also placed inside the clear hazardous materials bag.

DescribePack: The containers lids were leaking from the pressure of the packages on top of it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a hazmat bag as well as put into a hazmat tote to be inspected.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was found by a driver of belt two wet this morning around 8:12am was was place in a line tote. QA was notify about the Hazmat pkg and brought to the Hazmat cage. DescribePack: Upon inspection two of the bottles of liquid machine detergent caps were loose and came off and spilled. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was place in a line tote and brought to the Hazmat cage for process.

item.title: Report X-2023110043
item.description:
Report X-2023110043

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon arrival the box was found with a strong smell of gas. The bottom of the box had wet corners, so it was then placed in a clear hazardous materials bag and then into red hazardous bin layered with absorbent. DescribePack: Upon inspection the bottom flaps of the box were found wet. The inner top corner flaps and the slotted partitions were also found wet. When removing the partitions, one of the bottles was found with a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Most of the leakage happened inside the box but absorbent sheets were used around the area the box was found. The package was then placed in a clear hazardous materials bag and into a red hazardous bin layered with absorbent.

item.title: Report X-2023101444
item.description:
Report X-2023101444

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: SAN RAMON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CLERK INFORMED ME THEY SUSPECT THE PACKAGES TO BE UNDECLARED BASED ON THE SHIPPER'S INFORMATION. AFTER INSPECTION OF THE SUSPICIOUS PACKAGES IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THEY WERE COMPRESSED FEUL FOR TORCHES. SHIPPER PLACED THE DG INSIDE AN INSIDE-OUT BOX TO HIDE THE DIOMOND LABELS. CONTACTED HAZMAT HELP DESK FOR UNDECLARED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS: 1Z3R4A250391055678 AND 1Z3R4A250398107706. INNER BOXES STATE UN3161 WITH CLASS 2.1 FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND.

item.title: Report E-2023110215
item.description:
Report E-2023110215

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 31, 2023, seven (7) one-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN1263 impacted impacted dock floor. AS personnel solidified and neutralized the damaged pails of product. The damaged pails and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110112
item.description:
Report X-2023110112

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: FAIRFIELD

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver had placed a code 10: Inspection Required. I went to collect it, item was left in front of the van after returning from delivering packages. Unsure the exact sequence of events that led to the incident. DescribePack: Small piercing at the bottom of the container, possibly half a centimeter in width. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Item was bagged multiple times to minimize the leakage.

DescribePack: TWO OF THE CONTENTS ARE CRACKED UNDER THEIR HANDLES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG.

item.title: Report X-2023101412
item.description:
Report X-2023101412

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found leaking while being sorted for delivery during Inbound. The package was found leaking, and QA was called. QA promptly used a Hazmat tote to pick up the package and absorbent pads to clean up the leaking. The package was brought to the Hazmats to be inspected and processed. DescribePack: The package contents were spilling from the cap and were dented during sort. there was no bracing or filament in the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA brought absorbent and a tote to clean up what ever leakage was at location. Everything was handled with gloves and brought to hazmats to be processed and inspected.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: pkg was being loaded onto van line conveyor by package handler when bottom of box ruptured and contents fell out of bottom and onto dock. items broke upon impact. Managers on scene sectioned off the area, used absorbent pads for spill, and removed nearby personnel from area. I was called to the scene for immediate clean up. DescribePack: package failed at bottom of carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: use of absorbent pads for spill, use of fan for ventilation, use of cones for sectioning off area

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was been unloaded when the package handlers noticed that the box was leaking, and a QA was called for inspection which brought it for a thorough inspection to a certified admin. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was found that a bottle had a loose cap, causing the spillage, there was no inner packaging besides a slim tape on top of the caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was promptly brought for attention to an admin to get the proper PPE and mitigate any possible damage.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.
